t: Mark 1
John the Baptist Prepares the Way
The*p beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
As it is written in the Prophets: “Behold,*pn I send My messenger before Your face, Who*ld will prepare Your way before You.”
“The*ld voice of one crying in the wilderness: ‘Prepare*ld the way of the Lord;*sb Make*ld His paths straight.’”
John*p came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching a baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
Then all the land of Judea, and those from Jerusalem, went out to him and were all baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.
Now*p John was clothed with camel’s hair and with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
And he preached, saying, “There comes One after me who is mightier than I, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to stoop down and loose.
I indeed baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
John Baptizes Jesus
It*p came to pass in those days that*i Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
And immediately, coming up from the water, He saw the heavens parting and the Spirit descending upon Him like a dove.
Then a voice came from heaven, “You are My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
Satan Tempts Jesus
Immediately*p the Spirit drove Him into the wilderness.
And He was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered to Him.
Jesus Begins His Galilean Ministry
Now*p after John was put in prison, Jesus came to Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
and saying, “The*r time*r is*r fulfilled,*r and*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r at*r hand.*r Repent,*r and*r believe*r in*r the*r gospel.”*r
Four Fishermen Called as Disciples
And*p as He walked by the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
Then Jesus said to them, “Follow*r Me,*r and*r I*r will*r make*r you*r become*r fishers*r of*r men.”*r
They immediately left their nets and followed Him.
When*p He had gone a little farther from there, He saw James the son*i of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were*i in the boat mending their nets.
And immediately He called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, and went after Him.
Jesus Casts Out an Unclean Spirit
Then*p they went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath He entered the synagogue and taught.
And they were astonished at His teaching, for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
Now*p there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit. And he cried out,
saying, “Let us*i alone! What have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth? Did You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”
But*p Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be*r quiet,*r and*r come*r out*r of*r him!”*r
And when the unclean spirit had convulsed him and cried out with a loud voice, he came out of him.
Then they were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, “What is this? What new doctrine is*i this? For with authority He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey Him.”
And immediately His fame spread throughout all the region around Galilee.
Peter’s Mother-in-Law Healed
Now*p as soon as they had come out of the synagogue, they entered the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
But Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and they told Him about her at once.
So He came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and immediately the fever left her. And she served them.
Many Healed After Sabbath Sunset
At*p evening, when the sun had set, they brought to Him all who were sick and those who were demon-possessed.
And the whole city was gathered together at the door.
Then He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons; and He did not allow the demons to speak, because they knew Him.
Preaching in Galilee
Now*p in the morning, having risen a long while before daylight, He went out and departed to a solitary place; and there He prayed.
And Simon and those who*i were*i with Him searched for Him.
When they found Him, they said to Him, “Everyone is looking for You.”
But*p He said to them, “Let*r us*r go*r into*r the*r next*r towns,*r that*r I*r may*r preach*r there*r also,*r because*r for*r this*r purpose*r I*r have*r come*r forth.”*r
And*p He was preaching in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and casting out demons.
Jesus Cleanses a Leper
Now*p a leper came to Him, imploring Him, kneeling down to Him and saying to Him, “If You are willing, You can make me clean.”
Then*p Jesus, moved with compassion, stretched out His*i hand and touched him, and said to him, “I*r am*r willing;*r be*r cleansed.”*r
As soon as He had spoken, immediately the leprosy left him, and he was cleansed.
And He strictly warned him and sent him away at once,

and said to him, “See*r that*r you*r say*r nothing*r to*r anyone;*r but*r go*r your*r way,*r show*r yourself*r to*r the*r priest,*r and*r offer*r for*r your*r cleansing*r those*r things*r which*r Moses*r commanded,*r as*r a*r testimony*r to*r them.”*r

However,*p he went out and began to proclaim it*i freely, and to spread the matter, so that Jesus could no longer openly enter the city, but was outside in deserted places; and they came to Him from every direction.
